intro: Ecbolium ciliatum, commonly known as the silky bladderpod, is a flowering plant native to the western United States and parts of Canada. It belongs to the family Brassicaceae, which includes many other mustard family plants. The plant is characterized by its slender, branching stems and small, green, ovate leaves with ciliate margins. Its flowers are typically white or pale yellow, with four petals arranged in a cross shape, typical of the Brassicaceae family. The fruit is a silique, a type of dry fruit that splits open to release the seeds.
